P005667.project_name: Small & Medium Scale Industry Development Project (02)

keywords.cdata: agricultural output,agriculture,balance of payments,bank lending,banking system,bonds,capital goods,Central Bank,cities,Commercial Banks,competitiveness,CPI,credit policies,current prices,Decentralization,deposits,development banks,economic development,economic objectives,economic policies,economies of scale,equilibrium,exchange rate,expenditures,exports,feasibility studies,Financial Sector,foreign exchange,GDP,growth rate,import tariffs,imports,income,interest rate,interest rates,international competition,labor costs,labor productivity,legislation,M2,minimum wages,oil,price controls,price increases,production costs,public enterprises,subsidiary,taxation,technical assistance,transport,turnover taxes,unemployment,Value Added,wages,working capital

project_abstract.cdata: The Second Small and Medium Scale Industry Development Project plans to assist in financing economically and financially viable small and medium scale industrial enterprises through a credit line of US$27.5 million to five participating banks. The project also includes technical assistance to assist small and medium scale industries (SMI) in resolving managerial/technical problems and in designing and formulating new or extension/modernization/rehabilitation projects. It also intends to help commercial banks develop the necessary expertise to improve their appraisal and supervision of SMI. The cost of technical assistance will be covered by US$0.5 million from the loan amount and about US$2.15 million from local and bilateral sources.
